channel.title: Log on notes
channel.description: Recent content in Log on notes

item.description: mike re. regulators unit testing v. component testing? mocking database abstractions? “scope” of identity & consumer service is the identity linking robust enough to power an app that is exposing privileged functionality? is this scoped to marketing? use cases beyond cross sell? field based encryption of pii data in a relational database design patterns (abstractions between http concerns, business logic, data abstraction)
juan 1:1 re. loan mods scra(?) lowered rate while service members are deployed applying surpluss to principal (available for take back) isn’t legal rich & camilo will be working on this
juan finishing up late fees sandeep & yavor loan mods

2020 load meeting php7 upgrade auditors sometime next june what does a project plan look like? focus? edge facing most important - 1:1 with mike i dumped on definition of platform architecture pradeep’s “functional” definition vs the “non-functional” aspects lead arch job desc https://docs.google.com/document/d/1BZvEINVKs8GhAZi3PY7hcMTe5jb8SpNLIPLrf-TbBcE/edit?ts=5dcedf25#heading=h.scw4vkpswaou gitlab alignment meeting mirroring repositories and testing dark today upstreams not fupported, could be built with APIs tried to impress importance of this to PM may be expected by some for june audit hybrid intermediate state while (e.

nl localdev services aren’t in dca right now enforce this should go into DCA makes live edits possible (also makes things more consistent) second set of config details in horde.json kca implications local containers for mysql, rabbitmq, memcached expose mysql over 3306 snowflakes lamp-cms kca inmo-lead bulk data api for kls need for cpi by mid december, delivered in Jan

KCMS / NL 2020 priorities deflash php7 svn publisher mfa self-service dpk & ccg for a component, share secrets for multiple lambdas, separate env vars local map for each artifact/env could be using json for tf & building fragment models rather than tf tpls http://git.bvops.net/projects/DPK/repos/dpk-lambda-service/browse/src/fragments/_example-service/lambda.tf use ccg to generate env files & tf module fragment AR get w/ satish to build poc

dev circle nuxJs framework improving typescript support more active lately shawn w converting kid auth ui currently to test/poc karl like it standardizing procommit & editorconfig filter commits to fix them vs disallow commits could help clean up commit diffs or make them worse https://github.com/jokeyrhyme/standard-editorconfig/blob/master/.editorconfig need separate meeting to agree on style details standard lambda dpk 2 patterns 1 lambda, 1 handler, 1 deploy 1 lambda, n handlers, 1 deploy group by technical similarity, business context?

kls disbursements brd meeting onus transactions only fi v product level? product level offers more flexibility, probably necessary track fees, insurance etc regardless of “enabled” implications for roll out? data input requirement? tracking insurance etc. fees fees_gl_account_number + fee_description uniquely targets a fee multiple fee types may share a single gl ach (on us) posting on failure, manually fix (in core). Don’t worry about correcting kls data deposit type field (checking / savings) reporting?

cookie popup patrick can’t force on an FI produce “factory” way to roll it out FI’s responsibility if they opt out Fi is collecting the info, not kasasa 17+ states are implementing something similar need by Jan 1, but probably good enough to show progress towards this can mess with granular opt out, but patrick recommends skipping to global opt out still “essential cookies” (for inmo app etc.

envelope decision meeting w/ kloans kickoff explanation: my understanding is that option 2 is the current standard, but I can see how the standard could interpretted to imply option 1 needs clarification decision doc should either clarify standard or define reasons for why bypassing the decision is acceptable meeting notes: Ben - went over options & requirements used to frame the decision doc. Ben - What is the primary concern with option 2 / following the existing standard?

talked w/ rob about combining lamp teams sooner rather than later. he agreed in general & had other thoughts about re-settling mike & mike sooner rather than later as well tf sync w/ mason tf testing options Terratest, aws resources in go Tf compliance, behavior style Tf init, validate, plan, apple, destroy in a hermetic aws space need to meet w/ Mason & Satish to integrate lambda w/ ccg Regulators / Marketing tech stack stack
angela / klogin notes (see juans linked from it) https://confluence.bancvue.com/display/DEV/KLoans+to+KLogin+Migration+Notes

KLoans: team leads - sandeep, pedro, juan Backlog: plan how to measure and track architect capacity: new project is 50%, rtb is 10, new feature is 25 schedule one of daily meetings as arch team meetings: make an agenda, focus on strategic work figure out how to coordinate on shared projects with cloudops publicizing ccg / dpk standup stuff: status / show and tell / followup topics wed: team meetings every other thurs: backlog grooming w/ mike standup followups:
